author: {'steamid': '76561199563339903', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1042, 'last_played': 1705094458}
review: I love this game I feel like a little archaeologist :3 fuck the cleaning mini game though that shit is so hard but the goodness of the game outweighs it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199013690205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1691969447}
review: I highly enjoyed the different routes, diverse characters, and the story line. Despite the niche concept of the story being at an archaeology site, it was easy to follow and find the motivations for every character there. There was some French used in the dialogue that doesn't get translated, but that is because the main character doesn't speak much French whereas everyone around her does, but they speak to her in English. However, I would have liked for there to be something for the reader to know what the characters are saying just to keep me immersed and not reaching for Google Translate. The mini games were fun on the first play through, and were skippable from the get-go. The art is also very well made, and the cg's were all super cute! Finally, you get to interact with every character on every route, but get special scenes with the one you are trying to romance. It makes the story line very aligned in every route, and makes all of the routes feel more natural. Overall, I enjoyed the game and would recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561199213724547', 'num_games_owned': 25, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1077, 'last_played': 1702488377}
review:
C14 Dating is an absolute delight!

I will preface by saying, I've loved C14 Dating since long before I ever played it. I knew all about it, but never got a chance to play it until recently. I have already finished the entire game, with every single ending. It went by so fast, but I had an absolute blast-

The story is simple, but sweet. It's very slice of life, and might seem boring. I enjoyed the simplicity of what genuinely felt like just a normal life. It really helped me connect with the main character.

My favorite part of the game is how you learn more about each character. I would learn about one love interest's story when on another's route. The way everyone became intertwined was really cool. The main focus was mostly on friendship throughout the game. It really shows when one of my favorite endings was the group ending where everyone becomes close friends. You even learned more about the main character throughout all the different routes.

I can't think of any specific order to play through the routes. They all intersect at some points. I will say, my favorite guy was Kyler, but my favorite route was Deandre. Absolutely adorable.

Overall, highly recommend. Simple, yet sweet game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199174949472', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 921, 'last_played': 1688357894}
review:
It's a cute little - literally, it took me under 20 hours to 100% it - game. Maybe my bar is just that low, but I liked how MC is not dense and how I didn't cringe once while playing. Graphics are ok, music is ok, stat raising is not too annoying, story is simple, characters are cute. 
But maybe wait until sale to buy it, cause as charming as this little game is, it's not worth its full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060170343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 2714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1971, 'last_played': 1677643651}
review: The minigames are fun, the characters engaging. A bit vanilla, but definitely sweet.

author: {'steamid': '76561199387221369', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1637, 'last_played': 1674706635}
review:
I just finished Shoji/Deandre/Kyler routes. This is the best dating sim game I've ever played! The storylines are beautiful, the characters are all cute, and emotions among them are warm-hearted and genuine. The songs are also really great!

As an Asian female I identified the most with Shoji and sympathized with all reactions toward all the events. I even shed a few tears when Shoji finally overcame his self-doubt and timidity and confessed to Melissa...feel like I witnessed my own growth all the way through. The only thing I have issue with is Shoji’s eyes which are way too big compared to other male characters. It’s unrealistic and made Shoji like a child instead of an adult. 

Overall, it’s a unique, innovative, and excellent game. I really enjoy the whole experience. Please produce more games like this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198968973670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2110, 'last_played': 1662487346}
review: Love this game The only thing hard about this game is the puzzles I get stuck on One Puzzle so far and it makes my brain hurts

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198205704344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1643849012}
review: What initially attracted me to this game was the anime like art style. I also have played Winter Wolves games in the past and always enjoyed them. I have never liked their level up certain stats mechanic, but it is tolerable for the dialogue for me. I also very much appreciate the skip/fast forward button. While I found the Archeology aspect of this game to be very interesting, the mini games for this game were so confusing so I always skipped them. Unfortunately, they are necessary to leave turned on for some scenes. I greatly appreciated the walkthrough but it was still IMPOSSIBLE to get Shoji to dance with me (WHY SHOJI?!?!). Deandre's route seemed to show favoritism as his route seemed to be the most encouraged romance. His scenes seemed to get special treatment. I loved all the characters though in the end; especially Kyler and Shoji! I recommend watching a playthrough on Youtube or getting this game on a sale. Luckily I did!

author: {'steamid': '76561198413124953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2119, 'last_played': 1582488003}
review: Very entertaining and cute <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198033388937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 294, 'playtime_forever': 2896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1822, 'last_played': 1611135043}
review:
This game is fun, friendly, and sweet in the right amounts. I bought [b]C14 Dating[/b] when it came out, then got busy with other things. It's been a delight to get to play it now for the first time (January 2021).  I enjoyed the game and would recommend it to anybody who is in the mood for a slice of life, mostly non-angsty story with a bit of thinking thrown in.  While the story itself doesn't focus heavily on the diversity angle, it's nice to see representation of both disabilities and less typical potential love interests.  I fell completely for the (very) tsundere, overly-diligent Kyler, but I ended up being fond of everyone.

[b]Note 1:[/b]  the one w|w route is shorter because it was a bonus to the original game; however, the character involved is adorable and I found the story well-written 

[b]Note 2:[/b]  there is no voice acting, which is fairly standard for indie otome

Pros:
- the art is very appealing, and both the regular CGs and smaller chibi CGs are great
- the theme song is excellent
- the characters feel genuine, especially when dealing with either hurt feelings, or personal interests (this helps to overcome the fairly obvious tropes)
- the protagonist is lovely, without being perfect
- the game mixes a standard university/ training camp setting with something more professional; this provides a better sense that the characters are adults
- the mini-game in the cave dig portion of the game is fun if you enjoy picross puzzles
- both types of mini-games can be skipped
- smooth interface
- both romantic and friendship endings are positive endings
- the endings are nicely written, with lots of "awwww" moments [they can also feel a little abrupt, although that's partly the format of the game]

Cons:
- the in-game music is nice, but gets repetitive in places
- as others have said before, the stat-raising feels out of place: since only one stat is important to each route, a better choice might have been for "affection" to go up based on which activities you choose
- I'm not a big fan of having a random component to stat raising

[b]Overall:[/b] C14 Dating has some weaknesses, but it's better than average within the genre of slice-of-life otome.  Two stand-out items:  the CGs / CG moments are very cute; the main OP/ED song is excellent.  In any event, for better or for worse, you will probably pick up some info on archaeology/ anthropology!

author: {'steamid': '76561198126689861', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1494, 'last_played': 1607814906}
review: Very cute, fun dating game

author: {'steamid': '76561198058706308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1659763893}
review: This game is so beautiful, for so many reasons.  Yes, it's aesthetically beautiful - the art, the sprites, the CG's, everything is gorgeous.  But, it's more than that.  The story is equally beautiful.  All of the characters are amazing, fleshed out, wonderful people.  I enjoyed getting to know them all and being their friends.  I've only done romance route so far (Hendrick) but plan to do them all (no duds here!).  The depth of story is nice, as is the length, and the mini-games/scheduling is a bit different to other visual novels (though not all).  But, for me, where this game truly touched my heart was all the disability representation.  The PC is a diabetic, one character has a prosthetic arm, another has a cochlear implant... As someone disabled myself, I was overwhelmed by not only the representation, but how well it was done.  It was handled with grace and dignity, and none of the characters were othered or stereotyped in any way.  I can't thank the creators enough for this.  You have truly made my day to have discovered such a charming and wonderful game.  I can't wait to dive in and play more paths.

author: {'steamid': '76561198230877204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1130, 'last_played': 1599169422}
review: very casual but very nice. The way that they talk and react is very realistic therefor it is not full of epic drama or sexy adventures. But is is a very pleasant experience. Nothing deep but if you just wanna lay back and have some cute interactions and learn a bunch about archaeology, this is a game for you! (suddenly i sound like some wierd commercial??) lol

author: {'steamid': '76561198255960253', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 1161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1160, 'last_played': 1596278259}
review:
This was a good game, lots of paths, and dialogues to discover. Arts are nice to look at and characters are interesting to discover, even the girl! And I'm not into yuri/lesbian path normally, so it means something! It's nice to have different types of people, even some with a handicap (one is deaf, the other lost a hand in an accident). I never saw another dating game referring to a thematic like that (as much for handicap than an archeological job). There is even an asexual, even if more commons in the dating games, it's nice to find a character like that (he is older AND almost a teacher to you...) 
It misses only more body colors, they are all white, it's a little sad, even if the heroine is Latin-American... 
As I'm French the game makes me laugh sometimes, as there are some language problems and grammar wrongness while the Belgians speak in French, but I like the idea the story took place in Belgium with an American student causing some language restrictions. 

In short, some good ideas... that's a good Otome!

author: {'steamid': '76561198834164354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 565, 'last_played': 1594859733}
review: I haven't played through it all but I would say it's really good. I love the inclusion of disabilities from a guy with a chochlear implant to a guy with a prosthetic arm.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079630520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1586874771}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030043517', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1173, 'last_played': 1584340893}
review:
Very adorable dating sim game. Interesting characters where some of which has disability which is a nice touch and adds diversity.
Learned a few things about archeology terms and some other tidbits.
Two mini-games consisting of nonogram and a math based logic number. Both of which are skip-able.

author: {'steamid': '76561198823816570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1398, 'last_played': 1603217375}
review:
I always wanted to get this game, but a few of the negative reviews had me worried. I finally decided to buy it when it was on sale, and let me tell you, it was so good I felt a little guilty for not buying it full price. I fell in love with the four romanceable guys and struggled with trying to decide which one would be my last playthrough. I'll admit, after finishing my second playthrough, the mini-games became a little tedious, but it wasn't something that put me off the game. All the interactions with the characters made me so happy, I could not stop smiling the entire game. This is one of my favourite otome games ever, and I've played A LOT. 

All in all, I do not regret buying this game and I 100% recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121398682', 'num_games_owned': 19753, 'num_reviews': 1577, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1584338994}
review:
A fun visual novel with lovely anime-style graphics. In C14 Dating your character goes on an archeological dig and meets a bunch of boys, what kind of bones will she find? That's up to you ;)
https://youtu.be/omNCqo32scY

author: {'steamid': '76561198326019192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1703983991}
review: I enjoy the game a lot, I like the added bits of mini games that give a bit of something different too with the visual novel aspect - thought I also understand why some people were frustrated with the mini games as one of them especially felt like mostly educated guessing.  I played Deandre's route and I enjoyed it for the most part, there were a few pretty CG's, cute scenes, and most of the stuff the protagonist did or said without feeling like she was too "pathetic" or any usual complaints I can have.  There also weren't any characters I strongly hated.  The only real complaint I have wish there was ability for more control over success/failure of stuff or at least if you failed a task it wouldn't set you back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164972135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 761, 'last_played': 1568840838}
review:
C-14 Dating is about an American student who travels to Europe in order to participate in an archaeology project. What makes the game so good is not the plot, but your relationship with the other characters. It was very cute to try to make new friends and romance the hot guys. I enjoyed how friendly and positive everyone was. (yes, even Kyler was friendly in a weird way)

There are also some mini games, but they get boring after a while. However, you can turn them off if you want to, so it's no problem. 

I loved this game and I believe it's one of the best Winter Wolves visual novels. Trust me, if you like visual novels, you should play this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072123660', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1571513139}
review: The writing in this game is extremely detailed. I was impressed by how thorough they were with all the archaeology knowledge that was in this. I, personally, am very into archaeology and geology, but I can see how someone might not be into this game if that's not their cup of tea (it's so detailed that it may drag down the gaming experience for you if you're not into that kind of thing). The mini games are pretty fun, one it picross and the other is math based, I guess? I romanced Hendrik for my first play through and he is perfect <3 But all the characters feel quite real and unique. It's a charming story and I look forward to playing through everyone else's route.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056074855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1249, 'last_played': 1553242497}
review: This game is adorable. The characters are very charming and the art gives a very warm atmosphere to go with the story. Some of the mini-games (which are optional) were a little hard to get through as they get harder near the end of the game, but you do get rewarded for them. If you're in it just for the story, you can turn them off, which is a welcomed feature if you've already completed all of them. If you want a sweet summer romance story, this is definitely for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198185921402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1504, 'last_played': 1551372749}
review:
I really like this game a lot, for a variety of reasons.
To begin with, it has more than average diversity in it's cast, with a confident, likeable woman of colour as the protagonist, two disabled Love Interests (one of whom is also asexual) and one female Romance Option.
The romances are all extremely adorable and if you're more in the mood for friendship, each character has a Route for that, too.
The focus on archaelogy is pretty interesting, you can definitely tell that the writers did a lot of research. For me it was more of an entertaining gimmick, but if you have a thing for that subject, I would absolutely recommend that you check out this Visual Novel for that reason alone.
I think the only real problem I have with it is the stat managing, which has never really been my thing.
Oh, and if you're looking for something particularly deep or steamy, you might want to pick something else.
This is a cute, feel-good Romance/Friendship - focused VN with an archaelogy-themed setting. Nothing more and nothing less. But  I absolutely enjoyed it for what it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094695169', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 854, 'last_played': 1542230038}
review: I liked this game. It’s laid back, cute, with good art, and the minigames are actually interesting and fun! (And skippable if you wish). I wouldn’t say there’s anything groundbreaking here, but it was an enjoyable experience. I generally dislike games with random stat raising mechanics, but this one was easy enough to figure out. I recommend giving it a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063675165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1615020345}

author: {'steamid': '76561198399667506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1875, 'last_played': 1556317181}
review:
This game is absolutely lovely!
The concept of it is fun and bright, the minigames tie wonderfully into the setting (but can be turned off if they are not your thing!) and I am in love with literally every single character. It's so rare and refreshing to see a dating sim where you can befriend and smooch people both, and it makes the replay value even higher! 10000000/10 would woo my man with rock puns again. 
I can only recommend it for all the times it made me smile, and all the little facts it taught me, too. One of my favourite games, and possibly my current favourite on steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073155332', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1172, 'last_played': 1531783978}
review: As an Archaeology student I love this game! They hit on many diffrent concepts that you actually come up againt when you are doing work in the field! The romance seems pretty simular to any other dating game however.... good Archaeology game if you want a crash course!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079592078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2069, 'last_played': 1611308410}
review:
I am disappointed in this game.  I've purchased a number of the Winter Wolves game in the past and never had a problem.  But this game seems to be glitched up for me.   I basically tried to pick the Deandre route so many times following the guide for the Deandre route.  But it seems to be glitched up.  I tried it a number of times with minigames active, but that seems to end up still with alone route doing well in the field of archeology...  Then I tried with mini games off, which still ends up with the alone route but with character deciding to try a different field.

Also FYI, if you didn't notice before, which I certainly did not notice/know till i played -  Hendrik has prosthetic arm (thought he was just wearing gloves) and Kyler is deaf and has hearing aid (which kind of just looks like bluetooth or headphones).  These are 2 of the 4 male potential routes for you.  The only other 2 male routes, is Shoji who's personality seems a bit unappealing/dull and the other was Deandre, who's route seems to be glitched up for me.  Never tried for the other routes, only the Deandre route, because frankly they didn't appeal to me.  If I had known this, I probably would not have bought the game. 

I even tried uninstalling and reinstalling a number of times and still comes up with the alone route when trying for Deandre route.  So I've given up on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256857243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2382, 'last_played': 1517999191}
review: It was enjoyable, but with the lack of romance it wasn't worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043415728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1175, 'last_played': 1502242089}
review: It's okay, I guess? I mean, the writing isn't horrible, and some of the archaeology stuff is interesting, but the minigames get pretty boring after a while, and there's hardly any romance all. Seriously, you can't start a romantic relationship until like the last two weeks in game, so you might get two or three short scenes and that's it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999732661', 'num_games_owned': 1755, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 1156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1058, 'last_played': 1510454684}
review:
C14 is another otome game from [url=https://store.steampowered.com/developer/winterwolves]Winter Wolves[/url], and I'd have to say one of the most uninteresting of those that I've played so far.  I'd like to think it's the slice of life pace that loses my interest, but I've found myself reasonably interested in slice of life tales before.  Despite the subject matter being rather dull to me, I had hopes that the characters and romance would have propped up the unusual premise.  Sadly, they do not.

It almost feels like [url=https://store.steampowered.com/developer/winterwolves]Winter Wolves[/url] went through a checklist of things they wanted to include in the game but didn't develop any of them enough to make them feel meaningful.  Sure, we have a deaf guy, the chubby geek and the asexual teaching assistant who wears a prosthetic hand, but these traits rarely factor into the story other than being physical characteristics for the characters (we don't even get any interesting thoughts from Melissa about dating these guys).  I imagine they didn't want to offend anyone by misrepresenting handicaps, but not taking any risks in the storytelling feels like it's all a wasted effort.  It's actually sad that the stereotypical jock ended up being the most enjoyable character of the bunch considering that trope has been done to death in otome games; as crazy as it sounds, everyone else comes off as bland in comparison.

There's also a distinct lack of romantic tension throughout the characters' routes, taking until Week 7 (out of 8) before there's any acknowledgement of Melissa's feelings.  That's WAY too long for things to begin heating up in a romance story.  Granted, the writing is rather chaste, which is totally fine, but there could have been a little more emotional weight to the relationships.  Unfortunately, the dull premise and sluggish storytelling doesn't give the characters much to work with.

Unless you're really into archaeology, I can't say reading through the game's description of it is all that interesting.  For the most part the characters spend the entirety of their 8 weeks digging up and cleaning rocks and bones and going into detailed description on how that process works, but it's probably the most boring subject matter I've ever come across in a visual novel. I really don't care about distinguishing different layers of earth, how to tell rocks from bones, how Neanderthal tools were made, yada yada.  But I probably would have been okay with it if there was more excitement to the story than a couple of near-injuries and a camp festival.  In the end, the narrative simply wasn't engaging enough to keep me interested in the story or its characters.

So while the artwork is gorgeous (Deji is always great) and the presentation is excellent for an OELVN, it falls well short on the storytelling side of things. And as much as it pains me to thumb this one down, I feel I must.  Both story and characters are unmemorable, and even now I struggle to recall anything that sticks out in my mind after having finished all 5 routes.  C14 Dating is just...meh, and I cannot in good conscience recommend meh games to others, not at full price.  And given Winter Wolves' track record for game discounts, I doubt this one will ever get cheap enough for me to consider it worth recommending on sale, and that makes me a little sad.

[code][h1]Curated by: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32217440-Bad-Otome-Games/]Bad Otome Games[/url] & [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33004802-Chudah%27s-Corner/]Chudah's Corner[/url][/h1][/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198210290865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5327, 'last_played': 1537749551}
review: Love this game! Kyler and Shoji are my favorite, I like Deandre too. I love the archeaology mixed in and I think its great that they have people with disabilities and stuff. I think this game is just amazing for breaking out of the norm, thats why I love it. Look forward to more like this I hope!

author: {'steamid': '76561198200489242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 902, 'last_played': 1578967430}
review: This game is really nice, and the characters are really cool. I love all the different routes you can take, and it has a nice story to each route.

author: {'steamid': '76561198183911535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1504418495}
review:
All of the characters had more backstory than a lot of dating sims. The mini games are challenging but fun. The romances are some of my favorites in the genre. And, the amount of actual archaeology information you learn through the game is surprising. 

HIGHLY recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068554556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 964, 'last_played': 1529201743}
review:
A brightly colored, personable, fun game. All of the characters were relatable and despite initially playing only for the lesbian sub-route, I found myself exploring some of the guy's as well. 

The minigames were a lot of fun and I regularly return to my saves to go through them again. 

Score: 8/10
Definitely worth the cost if you're mainly looking to romance boys or play some nice minigames.

author: {'steamid': '76561198355644933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1501, 'last_played': 1541904267}
review: So far I've done 3/5 routes and I would recommend in a heart beat, the puzzles get a bit frustrating and I admit on my replays I started skipping the really long ones, but the stories were excellent I felt fulfilled at the end of the routes they were appropriate per each story, I like how a lot of the characters have a 'disability' it makes it more relatable and opens it up for more people to undertsand and relate to the characters, I will say Hendriks twist [spoiler] asexual [/spoiler]  through me for a loop its the 2nd time in a game that I've ran into it and I dont really lke it, but I guess it just adds more diversity and people can relate to it,  Im not hating on it ust always leaves me uneasy maybe because I can't undertand it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151755605', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1500845015}
review:
I really fell in love with this game. The characters are all unique and likeable. The story is not deep, but to be honest I think that's a nice change from visual novels/dating sims that spend too much time with overdone drama. It's also so much more realistic that way. Love the diversity and the humor.
At times I got a little frustrated with the lab minigame, but I think it's nice to have them in the game istead of "only" having choice options. (And you can turn the minigames off!)
If you're looking for a light-hearted, sweet dating game that's just a little different, this might just be the game for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960860345', 'num_games_owned': 1444, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1494971991}
review:
Really cute otome game that features a lot of diversity in the characters, including sexuality and disability. Not so diverse with race, though.

The routes are all really sweet, the humor is fun, and it's very lighthearted - a nice game to play when you just want to zone out and feel good. My only complaint is the price is pretty high for the content it offers - I'd grab it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198335384252', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1489351203}
review:
I've been playing this game for quite a while and I really enjoyed it. 

The idea is creative and I never played as protaganist who has illness (in other otome games...is there any?) and have love interest who have different illness. Not everyone is perfect. Fresh new idea. ;-) 

The artstyles are cute and great. The characters and backgrounds are polished. The love interest : Joan, Hendrik, Kyler, Shoji and Deandre (my favorite - you don't need to know ... i'm just gonna write it here...) have their own story and they give you a lot of reason WHY YOU SHOULD LOVE THEM. 

However, it's kinda short. I want to read more. 
Do you guys plan to make a sequel just like you did with Always Remember Me? If you do, SIGN ME UP. 

Enough said, get this game if you're an otome game enthusiasts like me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079326890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1371, 'last_played': 1490732251}
review:
C14 Dating is a nice, laid-back visual novel about romance and archaeology. (Like, seriously, lots of archaeology.) There isn't much of a plot: you are an American college student going abroad for a 2-month elective at an archaeological site in Belgium. There is little to no conflict, no "true route", etc. It's really all about interacting with the people you can date/become friends with, which is why I say it is a laid-back game.

Despite the lack of a plot, I would say that most of the game's strengths lie in its writing. The cast, which is pretty diverse--some characters have disabilities, as well as different sexualities and body types--is very loveable, and though some of them could be linked to certain dating sim tropes, they are well-rounded and not restricted to cliches. Interactions between characters and the MC are cute, and rather than a 'good end' and a 'bad end', each character has a 'romance end' and a 'friendship end' [strike]both of which made me smile like an idiot[/strike]. Even if you fail to befriend anyone, nothing bad happens. It's just a game that exhales niceness all around. On another positive note, the music is fairly nice and the art is usually well-done, although some CGs look a little awkward (Deandre, particularly, looks smaller and thinner in his CGs than in his sprites; and there are some issues with facial angles).

On the other hand... I was somewhat disappointed in the stat-raising system. I've played very few VNs based on stats, but they would usually require some balance (you would eventually need all stats to be at a certain level, which requires a strategy to juggle all possible activities in order to keep that balance). This doesn't happen in C14. If you want to get into a character's route, you just need to spam the hell out of one option and follow them to the cave or lab whenever you can, save for a few exceptions (the game never tells you where Joan is and there is one event of Shoji's that takes place when he was supposed to be at the cave, yet he turns out to be at the lab for... some reason). While this may make the game easier for those who don't like stats to begin with, it makes the whole system feel dispensable. It really only plays a significant part (in which you need to somewhat balance your stats and choices) to get the Group Photo CG and the Best Alone End. The minigames are entertaining at first, but quickly become tedious. Last but not least, this is the VN with the least intuitive choices I've ever played since Amnesia. There are occasions in which all choices available feel "neutral", and others in which a choice causes an effect opposite to what you would've imagined (this happened a lot in Kyler's route, particularly). 

All in all, I still enjoyed the game due to its characters and to how well some themes were handled (long-distance relationships, language barriers, friendship ends, and ESPECIALLY the asexual character route). I recommend it if you want a wholesome slice-of-life dating sim experience with little to no negativity and decent diversity. I do not recommend it if you're into dark, complex themes and/or very averse to stat-raising... or to using a guide. Because trust me, you'll probably need one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069159152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2420, 'playtime_forever': 1191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1191, 'last_played': 1489530262}
review:
This visual novel is a very interesting experience. First, the title C14 Dating is short for Carbon 14 Dating, the method by which one determines the age of remains found in soil layers. As a site where Neandertal camped, the cave they are excavating needs the use of such methods. Yes, this obstensively dating-sim can teach you a lot about archeology. The games are fun (and actually unlock a bunch of descriptions that serve to teach you about such concepts).

The potential friends/love interests are all unique and have good stories behind them. Some obstacles to overcome with individual interests are the language barrier, social anxiety, and grades. The protagonist also has Type-1 Diabetes, something that plays a prominent role in one of the unavoidable events.

I have yet to be disappointed by a Winter Wolves-produced game, so I can only recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118391725', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1718, 'last_played': 1590988755}
review:
C14 dating is another great game from winter wolves,with one of my personal favorite Vn artist as well!
during my first run of the game,i found myself already becoming very fond of all of the characters and the fun mini-games that give you a bit of a break from stat raising and other things.
i was glad that i continued to enjoy it just as much after playing my second and third runs- though i will admit,after some time the mini games go from fun to a bit tedious,but there's always the option to skip them for no major penalty that i could notice,so it didn't bother me very much~
the art is wonderful and the writing is just as amazing! its full of lighthearted,friendly banter and an interesting yet laid back story that i could easily just wrap myself up in and enjoy.
i also didn't expect to learn as much about archaeology as i did playing this game,which was a pleasant surprise~
another thing that had me very excited about this game was [spoiler] the fact that one of the characters is Ace~! it's pretty rare for me to find asexual characters in dating sim type games,so whenever i find them it always makes my day~  especially so in this game,because of the character,how it was handled and the pun that went along with it,haha~ [/spoiler]

All in all this game is a lot of fun,and probably my favorite winter wolves game to date.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051001713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1661487806}
review:
Was I expecting to learn more about archaeology from a dating sim? No, but here we are.
I'm a college student who dabbles in geology, Deaf studies, and swing dancing so I'm pretty close to the exact target demographic for this game. The play time can be a little short if you don't play the puzzles, but it's totally worth playing! Seeing the different fixed events from different perspectives every playthrough is really fun. The characters feel really natural, unique, and sweet. Tons of the experiences that Melissa has in-game felt similar to my own study abroad experiences. I especially appreciate seeing a Deaf romanceable character (with accurate Deaf culture and sign language info) and a sweet, pudgy little guy who isn't necessarily conventionally attractive. My only regret is that I didn't buy the game sooner.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998994537', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1027, 'last_played': 1634608248}
review: This game was pretty short but totally worth it. The characters were great and loveable and the mini games were super fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198284052959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1479875767}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026225589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1475812196}
review: I played this when my area lost power during Hurricane Matthew and I'm so glad I did! This is a DELIGHTFUL game, and I loved every minute of it. Super inclusive and cute, and the mini games are addicting. Definitely get it (and make sure to play Deandre's route ❤❤❤!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198027316824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1480594021}
review:
It's an adorable dating sim/visual novel. I love that the characters aren't perfect (I won't reveal anything though...). There are plenty of dating sims in which the characters are almost too perfect, which I find very frustrating.

I also love that it takes place in Belgium and that they added Dutch and French sentences (seeing as that is the first language for most of the characters). But that's probable because I am Dutch (and can understand the tiniest bit of French) and so I actually understand what is written.

Also like the mini-games, that makes it more than just a read-and-click game. Though admitting they do get a bit boring after playing them again and again and again, if you play (like me) the same game for several hours in a row, since there are only two mini-games. On the plus side, they do require me to actually use my brain during this game.

Love the music (which is not so strange, since it's from the Leetstreet Boys and I also like their music in Roommates) and even my mother (who normally kind of hates the sounds from my games) said it wasn't so bad to listen to. Enough variety to make sure it won't get boring eventually.

It's cute (innocent, if you like) and yet there are plenty of puns which made me smile. Overall, I'd say one of the better dating sim games I played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158309410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1469691547}
review:
I enjoyed this game and that is enough to give it a thumbs up, although for every little thing this game does right, there is a thing it does wrong.

[b]Song in the Main Menu is great[/b]. Whenever I opened the game, I stopped for a little bit to listen to it, but [b]music in the game is super generic and annoying[/b].

[b]I like the way that romancable characters look[/b]. They aren't just your standard otome pretty boys. They have different body types and they have their limitations. On the other hand, [b]their personalities are super cliche[/b]. You have your intelligent, cold and distant boy, that turns out to have a golden heart, you have easygoing sportsman and shy but kind nerd. Cliches aren't necessary a bad thing, as long as you can do something new and original with them or around them, but sadly, it's not the case.

I like the fact that [b]it's all about friendship[/b]. I hate when otome games, especially those sets in modern times, force you to focus on one particular character and, from the very beginning makes you know that romance is your main goal. Even if there are friendship endings, they usually feel like bad ends. Not here. I really liked how Melissa is getting along with people around her and how she gets to know them better. On the other hand, [b]romance is poorly done[/b]. This is a problem with many Winter Wolves games - it just came out of nowhere. Yes, I've made Melissa and Kyler getting along, yes, they have few cute scenes, that could point to to the fact, that they are developing crush on each other, but they spent so little time together (lack of scenes), that it doesn't feel emotional when she screams "I love you!" at the end. Like... when? How that happened? 

[b]Mini games seems like a step in the right direction[/b]. There are way too many of them (it felt like there were more lengthy minigames that actual meetings with characters that are interesting to you), sure. The lab one is partially based on luck, which seems pointless, but the cave one is challenging and pretty fun (if you want to play something like that and not, you know, focus on plot). Still, you have option to skip them and despite all the negative stuff I've just said, I can imagine it being a nice addition, if it will be done better in the future. [b] Stat raising, though, is annoying and pointless[/b]. Really. There is absolutely no reason why there need to be stats at all, especially, since you don't need to keep tracks of two stats, like in "Nicole" for example, but  only one. Want to date Kyler? Spam "study". Prefer Shoji? Spam "play games". What's the point of doing that, when you could chose particular paths or scores points with characters just by making choices within the plot? And there are choices like that here, so... Once again, why are we raising stats? For some extra endings, that also could be acquired my making right decisions?

author: {'steamid': '76561198044351201', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1467770614}
review: Writing's fun and the puzzles are pretty challenging - I liked it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053126111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1582, 'last_played': 1474745769}
review:
C14 dating is probably one of Winterwolves' best dating sims. And I've enjoyed all their games. 

You are Melissa, a university archaeology student, on a dig site in Belgium. You get to meet a selection of interesting people, and potentially fall in love with them. 

It's gratifying to see greater diversity, in so many ways: you have a saphic love interest, as well as an ace love interest. The protagonist is Hispanic. There are three disabled characters (protagonist is diabetic, one love interest is deaf, another has a prosthetic arm). 

Game play is fairly standard for this sort of game, with skill building and socialising with love interests till they're either friends or lovers etc... the game contains two mini games, which are skippable if you don't like puzzles or just want to speed up a second/third/fourth playthrough. Unlike in some earlier games, an effort seems to have been made with each love interest to make them at least somewhat compatible with our protagonist. You have some common ground with everyone and the relationships feel plausible. 

I'm also impressed at the level of detail and research that went into this game. Speaking as someone who's trained in both geology and archaeology, I can say that I saw no glaring errors. 

It's also nice to see such effort put into friendship paths, though there are occasions where it feels like you only got onto the friendship path because you failed at the romance path. It's also gratifying that there is an 'alone' ending which is positive (rather than being a lose condition as it is in many dating sims). 

All in all I can thoroughly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys dating sims. As I said at the start, this is one of Witnerwolves' best games so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054798264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1466992341}
review: Writing is very well done and storyline is interesting. It's a long game, which I liked, however it's not as "easy" or "intuitive" as some other games I have played to get to the "romance" ending. My first playthrough was about 3 hours and I never got to romance, just became friends. But overall I enjoyed the game, mini games were a little hard but the good thing is you can turn them off if you want.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077786973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 741, 'last_played': 1484779230}
review:
A very sweet and lighthearted otome! The art is gorgeous, the setting is interesting, and the characters are all very likeable. There's pretty much no drama or angst, instead just going for a simple relaxed atmosphere. The worst thing about the game is just that the minigames could be kinda tedious after a while, but given that you have the option to skip them without it affecting your game was very appreciated. And personally, my favorite route was Deandre; he was just such a sweetheart! 

I would defintely recommend this to anyone who enjoys otome games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020125851', 'num_games_owned': 15680, 'num_reviews': 840, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1464943497}
review:
[h1]An Otome Dating Sim / Visual Novel[/h1]
https://youtu.be/hdqZ256kW_w
+ The overall visual style looks great, with some very well detailed characters that pop with some vivid color
+ A pretty relateable story, about a girl who goes on a archaeological internship for 2 months in a foreign country and starts some new relationships with other students.
+ Various dialogue options with the ability to strike romances with various characters
+ Good writing
+ Nice relaxing soundtrack
+ Various light mini-games / puzzles

- Quite lengthy with a lot of dialogue to sort through. It would have been nice if some of it was voice acted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056622333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1475714018}
review:
[i]C14 Dating[/i] is a very cute dating game with an archaeology theme, something that I have not yet seen before. It has some stat raising mechanics, mini games, and a very diverse cast of characters to befriend and romance.

You are Melissa, 3rd year anthropology student on an archaeology summer course/internship in Belgium. Your fellow classmate couldn't make it on the trip, and so it's just you and your professor from California. That means you have to overcome language barriers, cultural differences & other boundaries to become friendly with the other students -- but at least there's camping, s'mores, and lots of cute guys and girls around!

[h1][b]Pros[/b][/h1]
+ Its theme, centered around archaeology & geology
+ The characters' diversity (disabilities, different body types, etc)
+ Pretty artwork
+ The ability to turn off the mini games & change the font
+ Lots of save slots

[h1][b]Cons[/b][/h1]
- The mini games [i]can[/i] get tedious, but you can disable them
- Some of the luck-based mechanics for the games & stat raising

It's obvious that the writers of this game knew a lot about archaeology, and I learned a lot as well! It's an interesting theme to which the mini games add some extra fun. The games themselves are light (one sudoku-like game & one luck/guessing game), as is the stat raising (you create a weekly schedule with activities that raise certain stats). Its overall atmosphere is very summer camp-like: sleeping in tents, cooking together, partying & setting up a festival.

Next to its archaeology-focus, the best part for me is the incredibly varied & diverse cast. You've got four guys and one gal on a "secret" route:

[list]
    [*][b]Kyler[/b], aloof neighbourhood tsundere with a cochlear implant
    [*][b]Deandre[/b], friendly & easygoing rugby player
    [*][b]Hendrik[/b], pun-loving geologist with a prosthetic arm
    [*][b]Shoji[/b], shy & chubby gamer with an artistic talent
    [*][b]Joan[/b], French flutist struggling with communicating in English
[/list]

And I really loved all of them!! They are vibrant characters whose background is expanded upon in their own route, in other people's routes, and during location/random events (either when you're working in the lab or in the cave). Most of them are also from different countries & speak different languages. It's such a varied and cute bunch of people all connected to archaeology in some way, and all trying to help out Melissa, the protagonist.

Would 100% recommend this if you're looking for a cute, diverse dating/otome game that doesn't have a standard story or theme. I thought it was a great experience :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197967063236', 'num_games_owned': 930, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1704673587}
review:
A well written visual novel with some of the best music I've heard in one. The art work is fantasic, the characters each are unquie and each stand on their own. Joan is pretty cute, while I personally can easily relate to both Kyler and Shoji. The puzzles are a lot of fun, though I must admit I enjoy the cave puzzles more than the lab. All-in-all a great game and I look forward to the next one game from Winter Wolves. 

Plot - 7/10
Characters - 8/10
Audio/Visual - 10/10
OVerall Score - 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198119797115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1461620688}
review: Really lengthy, keep in mind if that's your thing. Way too easy to build bond with Joan which might be interfering with other routes, and I couldn't even romance her (I realize it's possible but my bond with her was almost as high as I think it could get. And why not Chantal? That seems random). I've played through twice now (second time trying to pursue Kyler, choosing every opportunity to work with him and making sure to choose the answers than increase bond) and I've gotten the friendship ending both times. Also, the minigames will take probably almost half the time you're playing, so keep that in mind. I don't know... For over $20 (CAD) this was a big dissapointment. Maybe a guide will come out, then once the endings are more accessible it'll be worth while. Also, it's really annoying that there's NO info on the characters before buying. I took a risk because the designs were promising, but I usually never buy anything without knowing I like the characters. Unless you like ShyDude™, TsundereDude™, GenericDudes™, and GenericButCuteGirlThatBreaksLesbianHeartsEverywhere™ the characters are pretty boring save for some unique physical qualities (Deaf/Cochlear implant, prosthetic arm, chubby). Sorry for the bad review, but I've been playing this for 7 hours and I'm not the least bit satisfied.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043962105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1572976319}
review:
Note: Disregard play time as I bought this game much earlier during it's beta phase and finished it then. I just wanted to review this game as soon as possible, so here we are.

This is a cute little visual novel with puzzle mini-games and stat-raising as the gameplay. Puzzles were definitely fun for a time, but I admit it got a bit repetitive down the line. If puzzles aren't your thing, I remember the option for disabling it during the beta, so plus points to this game for catering to the varying tastes of the audience.  The writing was well done as well (I can't say anything more specific as I don't want to spoil any detail of the story) and I ended up liking all the characters shown on screen, which is always a good thing. As for the routes, I really can't say as frankly I bought this game for full price, twice (once during the beta, and then here on steam), solely for the yuri route. That particular route is very adorable in my opinion, so I left the game pretty satisfied with my overall experience.

Tl;dr : Spent $40 for this game solely for the yuri. No regrets.
